excerpt: Tropea is a municipality in the province of Vibo Valentia, in the Italian region of Calabria. It is one of I Borghi pi√π belli d'Italia. It has 5,661 inhabitants. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Tropea, located in the Italian region of Calabria, is a picturesque municipality known for its stunning cliff overlooking the sea. The town's rich history dates back to Roman times and has been influenced by various civilizations including Byzantine, Arab, Norman, and Aragonese. Tropea is famous for its red onions and beautiful beaches.
name: Tropea

excerpt: Byzantine-style monastery from the Middle Ages, set on a steep, craggy outcrop with sea views.
detail_description: The Santuario di Santa Maria dell'Isola di Tropea is a Byzantine-style monastery dating back to the Middle Ages, perched on a steep and rugged outcrop with stunning views of the sea. Its unique location on a large sandstone rock that was once completely surrounded by the sea adds to its allure. The sanctuary has two main sections: Spiaggia Mare Piccolo to the north and Spiaggia Linguata to the south, offering different beach experiences.
name: Santuario di Santa Maria dell'Isola di Tropea

excerpt:
The Coast of the Gods a scenic section of the Mediterranean Sea coastline in Italy.
It specifically refers to a 55 kilometres section of the coastline along the southeastern edge of the Tyrrhenian Sea, overlooking the Aeolian Islands. Wikipedia.
detail_description: The Coast of the Gods, also known as La Costa degli Dei, is a stunning stretch of the Tyrrhenian Sea coastline in Calabria, Italy. The area includes Tropea, a town rich in history and tradition with ancient churches and palaces lining its narrow streets. One of its most iconic landmarks is the church of Santa Maria dell'Isola perched on a bluff overlooking the sea.
name: Coast of the Gods

detail_description: Belvedere Piazza del Cannone is a must-visit spot in Tropea, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the Sanctuary of Santa Maria dell Isola and the expansive blue sea. It's a popular place for both locals and tourists to capture stunning photos and watch the sunset. Sit on one of the benches and take in the jaw-dropping scenery.
name: Belvedere Piazza del Cannone

detail_description: Piazza Ercole is the starting and ending point of the Tropea walking tour, a delightful one-hour stroll that can be extended with leisurely breaks for gelato and drinks. The late afternoon is considered the ideal time to embark on this charming exploration.
name: Piazza Ercole

detail_description: Spiaggia della Rotonda is a stunning beach located on the northern side of the Sanctuary of Santa Maria dell'Isola rock, offering soft white sand and calm blue waters. The beach provides beautiful views of the surrounding rocks and pastel-colored buildings, making it a favorite spot in town. While it can get crowded during peak season, visiting during off-peak times allows for unforgettable moments by the sea.
name: Spiaggia della Rotonda

excerpt: Paved road leading to the seafront with terrace restaurants, souvenir shops & ice cream parlors.
detail_description: Corso Vittorio Emanuele is a charming paved road that stretches towards the seafront, lined with delightful terrace restaurants, souvenir shops, and inviting ice cream parlors. It offers a pleasant stroll with opportunities to indulge in local cuisine, pick up unique souvenirs, and savor delicious gelato while enjoying the coastal ambiance.
name: Corso Vittorio Emanuele

detail_description: Grotta del Palombaro is a hidden gem located near Grotta dell'Isola, accessible by swimming or canoeing. This small sandy cove is mostly shaded during the day, making it an ideal spot to visit in the late afternoon. During summer, it attracts many curious visitors, but it's more wild and secluded during the shoulder season. The cave is wide and has its own little beach, tucked under the Santuario di Santa Maria like a hidden pearl.
name: Grotta del Palombaro

detail_description: Duomo di Maria Santissima di Romania, also known as Cattedrale di Maria Santissima di Romania, is a historic cathedral with a unique story. Built by the Normans in the 12th century, it has survived wars and natural disasters. The cathedral's exterior showcases an interesting blend of architectural styles from various periods of renovation and restoration. Inside, it may be less opulent than expected but holds significant historical and religious value.
name: Cattedrale di Maria Santissima di Romania

detail_description: Civico Museo del Mare di Tropea (MuMaT) offers an incredible experience delving into the paleontological history of Tropea, showcasing animals that once inhabited the area. Visitors can take a "dive" into the Earth-Water Globe's history from 15 million years ago to the present day, guided by passionate volunteers. The museum displays marine fossils and presents stories of various historical periods in Tropea.
name: Civico Museo del Mare di Tropea (MuMaT)
address: Palazzo Santa Chiara, Vico Ospedale, 89861 Tropea VV, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo Santa Chiara is a small arts center located within a charmingly weathered old palace. It occasionally hosts performances and exhibits, including the Civic Museum of the Sea of Tropea (MuMaT) with rare fossils and temporary exhibitions like 'Odyssey'. The historic building has been renovated to preserve its original structure, making it an evocative venue for cultural gatherings. Visitors have enjoyed attending concerts in this unique hall, appreciating its distinct ambiance.
name: Palazzo Santa Chiara

detail_description: Casa Elide Centro Storico - Le Case Rosa is a charming accommodation option located around 400 meters from Lido Alex. The rooms offer balconies with stunning sea views and are equipped with coffee machines for added convenience. For more details, pricing, and reservations, visitors can find information online.
name: Casa Elide Centro Storico - Le Case Rosa

excerpt: Capo Vaticano is a wide bathing place in the Municipality of Ricadi in Calabria, Italy. The 'Cape' is formed by a particular white-grey granite, which is examined worldwide for its geologic characteristics. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Capo Vaticano is a renowned coastal area in Calabria, Italy, known for its wide bathing places and unique white-grey granite formations. The coastline, also referred to as the Coast of the Gods, boasts sugar-sand beaches and bright turquoise waters. Visitors can explore the clifftop town of Tropea and visit the Sanctuary of Maria dell Isola perched above.
name: Capo Vaticano

detail_description: Affaccio del Corso is a must-visit spot in Tropea, offering the best and most popular viewpoint in the area. It's especially stunning at sunset, with its panoramic view of the golden hour casting a magical spell over the waters and sands below. The famous promontory of Santa Maria dell'Isola adds to the enchantment, creating a scene that will surely take your breath away.
name: Affaccio del Corso
address: Corso Vittorio Emanuele, 58, 89861 Tropea VV, Italy

detail_description: Al Migliarese Cocktail Bar in Tropea is a chic and stylish spot offering an extensive variety of drinks, including local specialties like Tropea's sweet onion marmalade. The bar provides a delightful taste of Calabria with its aperitivo concept, where stuzzichini (snacks) are included in the price of your before-dinner drink.
name: Al Migliarese

detail_description: Spiaggia del Cannone is a small and tranquil beach in Tropea, hidden behind the port and the San Leonardo rock. It offers crystal clear waters and a stunning view of the cliff of the Sanctuary of S. Maria dell'Isola. While it can get crowded during high season due to its small size, it remains a must-visit spot in the area.
name: Spiaggia del Cannone

detail_description: Dal Barone Food&Drink is a popular spot in the heart of Tropea, offering a variety of delicious food and drinks. Visitors can indulge in the famous Tartufo dessert, which has received rave reviews for its incredible taste. The bar also serves mouthwatering burgers and an extensive selection of beers at reasonable prices. With its prime location and welcoming staff, it's a favorite among locals and tourists alike.
name: Dal Barone Food&Drink
address: Corso Vittorio Emanuele, 58, 89861 Tropea VV, Italy

detail_description: Located at via Montevideo 8, Gelateria Mimmo has been serving delicious artisanal gelato since 1989. This family-owned establishment offers over forty unique flavors, including Kit Kat, bacio, mango, and pistachio. In addition to classic options, they also have creative flavors like corbezzoli, green apple, and mulberry. Customers can enjoy their gelato in soft brioche with a dollop of fresh cream.
name: Gelateria Mimmo

detail_description: Spiaggia A Linguata, located in Calabria, offers a fantastic swimming experience with its crystal-clear and warm waters. The beach is perfect for snorkeling and kids can enjoy splashing around and jumping from the rocks. Swimming around the islet leads to hidden beaches and remarkable caves like Grotta del Palombaro. Accessible by a steep staircase, Spiaggia A Linguata rewards visitors with one of the most beautiful sea floors in the area.
name: Spiaggia A Linguata

excerpt: Small beach with soft sand & clear waters, set below high cliffs & the town of Tropea.
detail_description: The Shore of Tropea is a hidden gem nestled beneath towering cliffs, offering visitors a stunning beach experience with its soft sands and crystal-clear waters. This picturesque spot not only boasts breathtaking views but also has historical significance; the town was strategically built on high cliffs to fend off pirate invasions. The narrow streets of Tropea reflect this clever design, allowing locals to stay vigilant against threats.
name: Shore of Tropea

detail_description: La Bottega Del Gelato is a must-visit in Tropea for its excellent freshly made brioches that are still warm, making them the perfect pair with their delicious gelato. They offer small brioches for those looking for a lighter option. Visitors rave about the quality of both the croissants and gelato, making it a highly recommended spot in town.
name: La Bottega Del Gelato

detail_description: Vecchio Granaio, a renowned eatery in Italy's Calabria region, is reputed for its top-notch pizza. With an emphasis on using fresh ingredients, their pizzas burst with flavors that are guaranteed to delight your taste buds. Besides their outstanding pizza options available during dinner hours (be mindful if you're American), the restaurant also offers other delectable dishes like Mollicata and pasta. The service is excellent, and patrons can enjoy outdoor seating while indulging in the delightful cuisine.
name: Vecchio Granaio

detail_description: La Pergola is a charming restaurant pizzeria located in Tropea, offering a perfect setting for a family or friends' dinner away from the hustle and bustle. The menu features authentic Calabrian cuisine, delectable seafood dishes, and the best pizza in Tropea at reasonable prices. The restaurant boasts an inviting ambiance with friendly service and a spacious interior. Chef Pasquale personally attends to guests, ensuring they have an exceptional dining experience.
name: La Pergola Ristorante Pizzeria

detail_description: Ristorante De' Minimi takes pride in using humble, locally sourced ingredients for their dishes. The majority of the produce comes directly from the estate's surrounding gardens, while 96% of the restaurant's ingredients are sourced from the region. Chef Emanuele Pucci is dedicated to personally selecting small local agricultural businesses and promoting sustainable production. The restaurant offers a gourmet dining experience with a menu that celebrates Calabrian cuisine, featuring creative combinations and showcasing the chef's culinary artistry.
name: Ristorante De' Minimi

detail_description: Largo Migliarese is a charming square located in the heart of the city. It is known for its lively atmosphere, surrounded by historic buildings and quaint cafes. The square is a popular gathering spot for both locals and tourists, offering a great opportunity to soak up the local culture. With its picturesque setting and vibrant energy, Largo Migliarese is definitely worth a visit for anyone looking to experience the authentic charm of the city.
name: Largo Migliarese

detail_description: Discover the hidden gem of Tropea by taking a leisurely walk along the scenic path from Tropea Train station to Grotta di San Leonardo. This small and secluded beach, tucked behind the port and San Leonardo rock, offers a tranquil escape from the crowds. At its northern end lies a small cave leading to a natural pool with mesmerizing colors and light effects, creating an unforgettable experience.
name: Grotta di San Leonardo

detail_description: If you're eager to uncover the hidden gems of Calabria, look no further than CST Tropea Escursioni, Tours & Experiences. This enchanting region at the tip of Italy offers a wealth of activities that go beyond typical sightseeing. While exploring on your own is certainly rewarding, joining guided tours can elevate your experience‚Äîthink dining with local families or thrilling white-water rafting adventures.
name: CST Tropea Escursioni, Tours & Experiences Calabria, Isole Eolie
address: Largo S. Michele, 8-9, 89861 Tropea VV, Italy

detail_description: Spiaggia della Mandorla is a hidden gem located on the outskirts of Tropea. It's not easily accessible, but that's what makes it pristine and uncrowded, even during peak summer. The beach is almost private and offers a beautiful wild setting. Accessing it requires some persistence and comfortable shoes for the rocky walk, making it unsuitable for families or older individuals.
name: Spiaggia della –úandorla

detail_description: Sunset Beach Club Tropea is a charming addition to the beautiful city of Tropea, located in the iconic and famous place in Calabria. The beach is divided into two main sections, with Spiaggia Mare Piccolo to the north of Santa Maria dell'Isola island offering a large free section for visitors to enjoy the golden sands and colorful umbrellas. The club offers small but convenient rooms with extremely helpful and friendly staff, making for a memorable stay.
name: Sunset Beach Club Tropea

detail_description: In the historic center, Tropea is a charming area where you can easily lose track of time strolling through its cobblestone streets. Lined with elegant 17th- and 18th-century buildings, this pedestrian-only zone is filled with an array of dining options, from restaurants to gelaterie. As you wander, catch glimpses of the sea and Santa Maria dell'Isola peeking between the historic structures, creating a picturesque setting that feels straight out of a movie.
name: Nel centro storico tropea
address: Via Umberto I, 89861 Tropea VV, Italy

name: B&B La Perla del Tirreno
address: Via Libert√†, snc, 89861 Tropea VV, Italy

detail_description: The city center is a vibrant hub filled with an array of dining options, including cafes, bars, and pizzerias. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely dinner at one of the many restaurants and indulge in gelato for dessert. The area also boasts numerous shops for those looking to explore retail offerings. Additionally, the convenience of accessing the center without navigating through restricted traffic zones makes it easily accessible. Furthermore, accommodations near the city center offer a peaceful retreat from urban chaos while providing comfort and cleanliness.
name: City Center

excerpt: This time-tested, small shop offers an array of hand-crafted, animated figurines & nativity scenes.
detail_description: Nestled in the charming town of Tropea, "Artistic Creations The Lighthouse" is a delightful little shop that showcases an impressive collection of hand-crafted animated figurines and nativity scenes. This family-owned gem stands out not only for its unique souvenirs but also for its enchanting moving statues that captivate visitors of all ages. As you stroll through the store, you'll discover intricate designs and lovingly crafted pieces that reflect the artistry and passion behind each creation.
name: Artistic Creations The Lighthouse

detail_description: The ESCURSIONI tropea / isole eolie COMERCI NAVIGAZIONE cruise agency offers an enjoyable and pleasant journey with professional staff. Despite some negative reviews, it is important to arrive early before departure time. The boat always left on schedule, which almost deterred the reviewer from going due to the bad feedback. One downside was that all explanations were in Italian and German, despite English being widely understood.
name: ESCURSIONI Tropea Eolie tours Comerci Navigazione
address: Corso Vittorio Emanuele, n¬∞36, 89861 Tropea VV, Italy

detail_description: Furch√¨ wine - Tramonto in vigna & Onion experience by Marco Furch√¨ offers a delightful private tour during the off-season. Marco's engaging explanations about his farm's products and processes make for an educational and entertaining experience. The tasting at the end of the tour exceeds expectations, with a variety of products including wine, cheese, pasta, jams, spreads, and bread. The onion experience is highly recommended as well.
name: Furch√¨ wine - Tramonto in vigna & Onion experience by Marco Furch√¨
address: Viale Don Mottola, Loc, 89861 Vulcano VV, Italy

detail_description: The Church of Saint Mary of the Announcement is in need of urgent restoration to prevent any potential harm to visitors. Despite its simplicity, the church boasts splendid features, including works in the sacristy. Additionally, it offers a breathtaking view and is conveniently located for those seeking a Saturday mass in the city center of Tropea. Nearby, visitors can also explore a stylish cemetery and enjoy top-notch restaurants with clear sea views.
name: Church of Saint Mary of the Announcement

detail_description: Grotta delle Sirene, located in Tropea, is an enchanting and evocative cave that may be a bit difficult to reach due to the lack of steps. However, this actually helps avoid overcrowding, making it a must-visit spot. The cave's interior is described as very beautiful and particular, with a purple hue. Despite its small size and potential lack of cleanliness due to visitor traffic, it remains a stunning attraction.
name: Grotta delle sirene
Monumento ai caduti
address: Piazza Minh Ho Chi, 7, 89862 Gasponi VV, Italy
